dialogue.text: Ugh, this is just not fair!
Skelly slowly approaches Mayuka.
I'm sorry, Mayuka. It was wrong of me to judge you by how you initially looked.
You're a very scary ghost and you probably scare tons of people! You even gave me a fright when I first got here.
You're good at what you do.
Mayuka becomes tired and goes back to normal again.
They fall to the ground and become pitch black like before. Azur makes more whispering noises.
I'm so sorry for the outburst...
It's tiring hearing the same thing over and over when it's not who I would like to be.
It was wrong of me to throw stuff around like that...
Aw, no worries, I forgive you. I'm still a bit shaken up though.
Ah, my apologies too... Here.
They take out their sword again and pull the Sunstone off of it. They hand it to Skelly.
You were suprised that I had this, so you probably know more about it than I do. It'd probably be better for you to have it.
Thank you so much! I've been looking for these things.
Of course! If I kept it I feel like more chaos would happen.
Say, if you're looking for something to do, I was going to explore the town more.
Maybe some other day we could meet up somewhere and explore!
I'd love to! If we go during the day though I might need a parasol.
Sounds good! I'll make sure to bring one for you.
Well, I think I'm going to go rest... I didn't even think ghosts could feel tired until now. I'm exhausted.
Alright, Have a good rest Mayuka. It was nice to meet you!
Goodbye, Skelly! Good luck on finding those Sunstones!
Azur and Mayuka wave as Skelly walks back through the hallway she entered from.
She sees the paintings again while walking out, and they're completely empty.
Huh.. I still wonder who those people were. Maybe they were related to the Sunstones in some way?
Nah, that seems like too far of a stretch. They were probably people that the ghosts made up.
...Maybe...
She walks out of the mansion.
Hmmm... Now to find somewhere to stay.
